rationales.achievement: He tracks and values top department review performance as a meaningful success signal.
rationales.benevolence: He stays late to help Katja through a difficult parent-complaint situation.

rationales.achievement: He revisits outcome metrics to verify continued professional excellence.
rationales.power: The nomination issue is experienced as lost status and recognition within his institution.

rationales.benevolence: He reflexively says yes to multiple colleagues' needs and mentorship requests.
rationales.self_direction: He describes being unable to enforce his own priorities and boundaries around time.

rationales.benevolence: Work obligations crowd out close-family responsiveness, including forgetting his sister's birthday call.
He invests in both relational repair with Brigitte and continued support for mentees.
rationales.achievement: He delays his own conference paper again despite deadline pressure.

rationales.benevolence: He spends the evening helping Leon with rubric design.
rationales.achievement: He explicitly substitutes others' work for his own conference writing yet again.
He secures conference attendance approval, re-engaging his own professional development.
rationales.benevolence: He makes a present, agenda-free call with Hilde and listens attentively.

rationales.achievement: He produces strong paper pages and advances his core argument substantially.

rationales.self_direction: He sets a direct temporary boundary with mentees despite anticipated guilt.
rationales.achievement: That boundary immediately creates momentum on his own paper draft.

rationales.benevolence: He recognizes his wife's adaptation to chronic absence, evidencing relational neglect.
rationales.achievement: He identifies a repeated pattern of choosing measurable professional outputs over presence.
